fields.description:
When you create a link to an undefined page, you should be able to open it form the editor and it opens in a new create action.

It looks like we've broken this feature. It's missing /wiki from the URL for PUG.

Steps to re-produce:
* Open a new page
* Use autocompelte to link to a new page [my new page (then keypress down and select "Create link to new page")
* Hit enter
* Click on the link and select "Open link"
Outcome: Loads a 404
Expected: Should load the create page action with that page title 


---

fields.description:
Using Confluence 4.3.2 and Dynamic task list 4.1.3. Dragging to re-order a task in a Dynamic Task List produces the following errors in the log:

{quote}
2013-01-10 16:43:43,972 ERROR [TP-Processor2] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction
 -- url: /plugins/servlet/tasklist | userName: username | referer: https://...
2013-01-10 16:43:43,976 ERROR [TP-Processor2] [sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl] execute Could not synchronize database state with session
 -- url: /plugins/servlet/tasklist | userName: username | referer: https://...
2013-01-10 16:43:43,981 ERROR [TP-Processor2] [ContainerBase.[Standalone].[localhost].[/]] log Unhandled exception occurred whilst decorating page
 -- url: /plugins/servlet/tasklist | userName: username | referer: https://...
org.springframework.dao.ConcurrencyFailureException: Hibernate operation: could not update: [com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Page#75956371]; SQL []; Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction; nested exception is com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLTransactionRollbackException: Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction
	at org.springframework.jdbc.support.SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator.doTranslate(SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator.java:109)
	at org.springframework.jdbc.support.AbstractFallbackSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(AbstractFallbackSQLExceptionTranslator.java:72)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager.convertJdbcAccessException(HibernateTransactionManager.java:619)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager.convertHibernateAccessException(HibernateTransactionManager.java:605)
.
.
.
Caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLTransactionRollbackException: Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction
{quote}

Verified in latest Chrome, Firefox, and IE8 and in an environment with no third-party plugins installed.

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add a dynamic task list macro with no data, then save the page.
# Add the following tasks into the task list:
#* test
#* test2
# Drag test so that it sits below test2, then drag test again so that it sits back up at the top of test2.

You will notice the deadlock errors after doing that. 

h3.Fix
This is no longer reproducible in Dynamic Tasklist 2 version 4.1.6 which is bundled with Confluence 5.0.1 and up
fields.summary: Deadlocks when re-ordering Dynamic Tasklist

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27731].
  {panel}

According to the second example from [this documentation|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/CHRT/Gantt+Charts], it adds the _rangeAxisRotateTickLabel_ parameter set as _true_ on Confluence Gantt Chart:

{noformat}
{chart:type=gantt|dataOrientation=vertical|displayData=before|width=500|rangeAxisRotateTickLabel=true|dateFormat=MM/dd/yyyy}

{csv:output=wiki|id=Plan}
Category, Parent\\task, Task, Start, End, Percent\\complete
Plan, , Create issue, 1/30/2007, 2/1/2007, 30%
Actual, , Create issue, 1/30/2007, +3, 70%
Plan, , Provide examples, 1/30/2007, 2/7/2007, 100%
Actual, , Provide examples, 1/30/2007, +5, 100%
Plan, , Code, 2/1/2007, 2/11/2007
Plan, Code, Initial code, 2/1/2007, +3
Plan, Code, Tests, 2/5/2007, +3
Plan, Code, Final, 2/9/2007, +2
Plan, , Write docs, 2/9/2007, 2/11/2007
Plan, , Release update, 2/10/2007, 2/12/2007
{csv}

{chart}
{noformat}

When you insert it via Wiki Markup it will look like:

!img1.png!

However, if you'd like to change the _rangeAxisRotateTickLabel_ parameter in order to set it to _false_, as *this parameter is not available via UI*, you need to:
# remove the chart
# edit the wiki markup 
# and then insert it again, which causes you some extra manual work.

This is the output when changing the _rangeAxisRotateTickLabel_ parameter to _false_:

 !img2.png!
fields.summary: rangeAxisRotateTickLabel parameter not available via UI on Confluence Gantt Chart
Admin should be able to choose the order of the spaces in the dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27729].
  {panel}

Problem from CONF-24596 seems to continue.

You can assign the user by clicking the blank area but it doesn't seem to stick. I've tried everything I can think of to make this work. It just doesn't work.

h3.Steps to reproduce:
# Select a page and switch to edit mode.
# Click Insert > Other Macros
# Search for TaskList
# Add a TaskList macro and save the page
# View the page and add a task to the task list.
# Expand the task to see the current assignee.
# Click the single person icon to get the user search.
# Enter part of a user name (Steve) and click Search
# From the results, check one of the users and click "Select User(s)"
# Refresh page and its gone

h3.Workaround
If you hit Enter while typing the user, it apparently works.
fields.summary: Tasklist Macro not able to assign user
Activity stream macro shouldn't use a fixed width as default
Copying a table row with keyboard shortcut doesn't enable paste row button on toolbar

Recent pages

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a SSL protected Confluence
# Attach a mp4 file to a page, and use the multimedia macro to display the mp4 file
# Navigate to that page with IE (in an environment that does not have Quicktime installed, so that IE will fall back to using Windows Media Player to play the file)

This will show a certificate error in IE on the first attempt to view the page. 

So far, we've only seen this affecting mp4 files. We suspect that the following lines are causing the issue:
{code}
<object classid="clsid:02BF25D5-8C17-4B23-BC80-D3488ABDDC6B" codebase="https://www.apple.com/qtactivex/qtplugin.cab" data="https://www.example.com/download/attachments/30671645/sample_mpeg4.mp4" height="200" type="video/mp4" width="200">
                <param name="autostart" value="false">
                     <param name="autoplay" value="false">
                     <param name="controller" value="true">
                     <param name="data" value="/download/attachments/30671645/sample_mpeg4.mp4">
                     <param name="src" value="/download/attachments/30671645/sample_mpeg4.mp4">
                     <param name="type" value="video/mp4">
                 <embed autostart="false" autoplay="false" controller="true" height="200" src="https://www.example.com/download/attachments/30671645/sample_mpeg4.mp4" type="video/mp4" width="200">
    </embed>
</object>
{code}

You can also copy and paste the code above into a text file, and name it as smth.html. Then put the file in your {{ConfluenceInstallationDirectory/confluence}} folder. Navigate to it via https://<yourConfluenceURL>/smth.html , and you will be able to reproduce the issue. Removing {{codebase="https://www.apple.com/qtactivex/qtplugin.cab"}}, however, will get rid of the issue. Give that a try. We need to get rid of that codebase parameter in the multimedia macro to avoid this.
fields.summary: Multimedia Macro in Confluence causes Certificate Error in IE, if Quicktime Plugin is not installed
Add the user to watcher list upon mentioning on the page.

fields.description:
h4. Issue Description
When user link to a page through link function in Confluence and the target page is renamed, the link in the comment will be broken, whereas the link in the content page will be renamed. This issue is a regression of CONF-8170

h4. Steps to replicate
# Create a Page A and Page B
# Put a link to Page B on the Page A content
# Put a link to Page B on the Page A comment
# Rename Page B to Page C
# Notice that the link on page content will be changed and the link on the comment will be broken (red color)
fields.summary: Link to page in comment is broken when linked page is renamed

fields.description:
Currently gadgets do not cache failure when an error occurs, on this can lead to multiple http requests from the server to the failing gadget provider on every page view.  We should implement some sort of exponential backing off mechanism, similar to the ExponentialBackingOffFailureCache in the atlassian-nav-links-plugin.

This would also remove many messages from the logs along the lines of: 
{code}
2013-01-09 16:57:31,755 WARN [http-9081-8] [plugins.gadgets.metadata.GadgetsMacroMetadataProvider] getData Unable to parse gadget spec 
[ https://xxxx/wiki/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets:confluence-page-gadget/gadgets/confluence-page-gadget.xml ]: 
org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException: Unable to retrieve gadget xml. HTTP error 504
{code}
fields.summary: Gadgets should cache failure as well as success
Add Warning when Dragging and Dropping a File onto a Page

fields.description:
When waching a page with a dynamic tasklist with at least one task, without being logged in Confluence (anonymous access), a JS error is raised and the execution of JS stops.

The error message is:
{noformat}Uncaught ReferenceError: disabled is not defined       confluence.extra.dynamictasklist2:web-resources.js:347{noformat}

I used version 4.1.3 of the plugin Dynamic Tasklist 2, Confluence 4.3.3 and 4.2.13 and Chrome.
fields.summary: Anonymouns view of dynamic tasklist causes js error

fields.description:
In confluence 3.5.x, a user is allowed to do an excerpt-include macro (within the link wiki macro ([])).  However, in Confluence 4.3.x, this feature throws an internal server error. 

For example, in Confluence 3.5.17, a user enters the following excerpt-include macro:
{noformat}
[{excerpt-include:latest-page-version|nopanel=true}|http://samplewebsite.com/{excerpt-include:latest-page-version|nopanel=true}|download from mobile]
{noformat}

!step1.png!
!step2.png!

In Confluence 4.3.2:
!step3.png!
fields.summary: Using excerpt-include macro in 4.3.x throws internal server error

* Source build test harness:  https://svn.atlassian.com/svn/private/atlassian/source-distribution-test-harness/trunk/pom.xml (see {{confluence-restricted-jars}} for the list of jars)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27701].
  {panel}

Customers want the ability to:
* Remove old versions of pages older than specific date (e.g. get rid of anything older than 6 months)
* Limit the number of old versions kept (e.g. limit to 5 previous versions)

In order to:
* Reduce the database usage of Confluence, particularly on frequently- or automatically-updated pages
* Comply with legislative document destruction requirements (e.g. delete content older than some years).

These tasks could be done manually via space admin, or triggered by an automatic housekeeping task.
fields.summary: Ability to administer number of page versions for a given space or page

fields.description:
h2.Steps to reproduce:

Using Confluence 4.3.5 and JIRA 5.1.4

# Create an application link between both products.
# Get the Road Map gadget URL.
# Add the gadget URL into your _External gadget_ in Confluence.
# Create a new page and try to add the Road Map gadget.
# You'll see that you'll get a blank screen in the preview area like this - which cause Road Map gadget unable to be successfully added to Confluence page:
!ttttt.jpg!

No workaround available at the moment. The issue persists even after GZIP compression has been disabled in JIRA & Confluence. The Road Map gadget can be displayed/rendered fine in JIRA server.

Last tested against Confluence 5.4.1 (bundled with Applink Plugin v4.0.11) with JIRA 6.1.7.  There is no difference to the problem regardless if OAuth or Trusted Application is configured. Application link is working fine too as we've verified that JIRA Issues macro functionality is working fine.
fields.summary: JIRA Roadmap gadget preview is blank and it is not possible to add it to a page

fields.description:
In the Confluence 4.x editor, when the newline preceding a heading is deleted, the heading is reformatted to plain text. For example, when I have this text in the editor (as if it were entered using wikitext):

{noformat}
h1. First heading
Some text
h2. Second heading
More text
{noformat}

When I do this:

- Place cursor at the beginning of the word "Some"
- Hold shift and press down-arrow
- Press delete

I expect to end up with this:

{noformat}
h1. First heading
h2. Second heading
More text
{noformat}

But instead I end up with this:

{noformat}
h1. First heading
Second heading
More text
{noformat}

The heading formatting is lost. This is inconsistent with at least two other scenarios: (1) Deleting a newline preceding a bulleted list, and (2) Deleting a newline preceding a block of preformatted text, both of which retain the formatting of the text that follows the newline, which is correct/expected behavior.

This problem however is not reproducible in IE9.
fields.summary: Heading loses formatting when preceding newline is deleted

The version of the Balsamiq Mockups plugin currently bundled with Confluence OnDemand is 2.1.6. The latest version (2.2.2) was released in October 2012.

This updated version has a fix for a bug where images don't display in IE.

https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.balsamiq.confluence.plugins.mockups

Can we work out some way to stay on top of these updates so that Support doesn't have to keep prodding for plugins like these to be updated?

fields.description:
h3. Summary Of The Bug

When user created a new "Internal directory with LDAP authentication" with any type of directory configured. The search filter saved is stuck and will not changed even if the user change the directory type.

h3. How to Replicate The Issue

# Create a new "Internal Directory with LDAP Authentication"
# Choose "Microsoft Active Directory" as the "Directory Type"
# Save the configuration
# Access the "Directory Configuration Summary"
# The saved {{ldap.user.filter}} value is {{"(&(objectCategory=Person)(sAMAccountName=*))"}}
# Modify the previously created directory
# Change the directory type to "Sun Directory Server Enterprise Edition"
# Save the configuration
# Access the "Directory Configuration Summary"
# The saved {{ldap.user.filter}} value is {{"(&(objectCategory=Person)(sAMAccountName=*))"}}
# As Sun LDAP does not have {{sAMAccountName}} user won't be able to authenticate against the LDAP server

h3. Workaround

Follow the following workaround if *the problematic directory is a new directory* with very few users:

# Delete the previously created directory
# Create a new one with the correct directory type
# Saved

Follow the following workaround if *the problematic directory is an old directory* with many users already registered:

# Access "Directory Configuration Summary"
# Take note of the directory id of the problematic directory
# Shutdown Confluence
# Create a database backup as a safety precaution
# Access your database and execute the following SQL query
{code:SQL}
UPDATE cwd_directory attribute SET attribute_value = '<Set the appropriate LDAP search filter>' WHERE directory_id = <Input the directory id noted earlier> AND attribute_name = 'ldap.user.filter';{code}
# Restart Confluence
fields.summary: Changing The Type of LDAP on Delegation Directory Configuration Does Not Change The User Search Filter

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Type: {{Bold: not bold}}
# Make the {{Bold:}} text to be bold
# Place the cursor before the "B" letter in {{Bold:}} text
# Press SHIFT + ENTER. It should look like the following:
!screenshot1.jpg!
# Place the cursor _after_ the ":" character in {{Bold:}} text
# Press ENTER

h4. Expected Results
The formatting is still intact for text {{Bold:}} and the breaks between the texts are not changed

h4. Actual Results
The formatting is lost for text {{Bold:}}, but the editor thinks that the text is already bolded. Toggling the bold button on the editor creates another line break and the bold button is still toggled

!screenshot2.jpg!

Saving the page will result in the formatting to be lost for this text. Reapplying the formatting will not result into this issue again

h4. Environment Information
Tested in IE 9 and IE 8. Not reproducible in Firefox or Chrome.

h4. Workaround
# Insert Expand Macro
# Press SHIFT+ENTER to create a new line
# Type: {{Bold: not bold}}
# Make the {{Bold:}} text to be bold
# Place the cursor _after_ the ":" character in {{Bold:}} text
# Press ENTER

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27666].
  {panel}

This issue strongly affected the Confluence Enterprise Hosted Migrator work. Here is how to reproduce the issue.

# Create a plugin and a component in tha plugin. 
# Create a webwork action.
# Attempt to setter inject the component into the webwork action.
# Attempt to run something that is not the execute() method and see that the component does not get injected and the variable is null instead.

If you need an example plugin you can use the [Confluence Enterprise Hosted Migrator|https://bitbucket.org/vchoy/jira-migrator] and use the confluence-migrator branch.

The core problem seems to be that the autowiring is failing for the Webwork action for certain methods. I am not certain why. I enlisted [~fakraemer]'s help on this issue and he said "i can see the correct config being registered in com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.XWorkModuleDescriptor.addAction(Element, PackageConfig) but for some reason it's not loaded when the action is created". Which we both think is likely to be a bug.

In short, this issue makes everything that is not the execute() action unuseable for standard development.

I have attatched two images of me performing a single step in the debugger if you need proof that the autowiring is not being run and there is a problem.
fields.summary: Webwork action does not get plugin components injected

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27663].
  {panel}

If the global settings stored in the bandana table get corrupted somehow, then starting Confluence will _completely_ blow those settings away.  

Among other visible problems, this will lead to the contextPath property returning null, which can break various other things.

More importantly significant data, such as warning messages, and security settings, is stored in these settings.  Sometimes the loss is not even apparent for some time.

This condition should really raise an application level failure condition to be investigated by system administration.
fields.summary: Failing to retrieve settings from Bandana leads to them being broken

fields.description:
h4. Summary of the issue
Importing XML site backup from a SQL Server-based or PostgreSQL-based Confluence to a MySQL-based Confluence fails due to size limit for DATA column in AO_9412A1_AOREGISTRATION table (maximum size limit is 65535).

In SQL Server-based or PostgreSQL-based Confluence database, DATA column in AO_9412A1_AOREGISTRATION table datatype is set to {{NTEXT}} and {{TEXT}} respectively. These 2 datatypes can hold string up to 1GB or 1073741823 bytes/characters.

In the other hand, it seems that in the Active Object, the biggest string-based data type for MySQL is TEXT. Which could only hold data up to 65535 characters/bytes. Therefore, any data/value in TEXT/NTEXT-based column that contains more than 65535 characters/bytes in the SQL Server-based or PostgreSQL-based Confluence database, would fail/skipped during the import to MySQL-based Confluence.

The following appears in the log:

h4. Workaround
Rather than importing the Site XML backup during setup wizard, install a fresh MySQL-based Confluence. Then go to Confluence Admin > Backup & Restore > Restore the site XML backup. The import should finish successful, but the affected data/rows will be skipped and not imported to the new Confluence database.

fields.description:
h3.Problem
Confluence does not support multi valued attributes, such as doubled cn, it fails with the following logs:
{code}
2012-12-26 16:47:42,733 INFO [http-8090-4] [crowd.embedded.admin.ConfigurationController] onSubmit Configuration test successful for user directory: [ Delegated LDAP Authentication ], type: [ DELEGATING ]
2012-12-26 16:47:44,986 INFO [http-8090-4] [crowd.embedded.admin.ConfigurationController] doInTransaction User directory updated: [ Delegated LDAP Authentication ], type: [ DELEGATING ]
2012-12-26 16:48:31,245 INFO [http-8090-4] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DelegatedAuthenticationDirectory] authenticate User newtestguy could not be found initially, but when cloning the user internally, user exists
2012-12-26 16:48:31,247 WARN [http-8090-4] [atlassian.seraph.auth.DefaultAuthenticator] login login : 'newtestguy' tried to login but they do not have USE permission or weren't found. Deleting remember me cookie.
{code}

And LDIF for failing user:
{code}
version: 1

dn: cn=Test, o=sevenseas,dc=example,dc=com
objectClass: top
objectClass: inetOrgPerson
objectClass: person
objectClass: organizationalPerson
cn: Test
cn: NewTestGuy
sn: test
displayName: User test
givenName: User
mail: test@user.com
uid: testuser
userpassword:: YWRtaW4=
{code}

h3.Workaround
Use a single attribute value, such as *uid*.
fields.summary: Confluence does not support multi valued attributes from LDAP

Add a blog posts macro with only titles showing. You'll see a dot next to the author's name. Reproduce in Chrome doc theme. Reported against all themes though. 

https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/ADVMACROS-206
{quote}
Black dot appear when \{blog-posts} macro are rendered on IE and Chrome and content type is title. Firefox rendered the macro perfectly fine (no black dot).

In Chrome, black dot appear at the end of the blog creator name

In IE, black dot appear in the middle of the blog creator name
!IE.png|thumbnail!
{quote}

fields.description:
h2. Summary of The Bug

Noise on the logs produced by a deprecated method which is {{getMergedContent}} use in Confluence release version 4.3.5 in the following {{vm}} file:

{code}
<Conf_Install_Dir>/confluence/users/viewmydrafts.vm{code}

In the mentioned file, the deprecated method could be found at line 70:

{code}
#if ($draftManager.getMergedContent($draft)){code}

As mentioned [here|http://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/latest/com/atlassian/confluence/pages/DefaultDraftManager.html#getMergedContent%28com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Draft%29] the above method should have been deprecated

Here is the stack trace written on the logs:

{code}2012-12-20 11:53:28,401 WARN [http-192.168.1.2-8090-13] [confluence.velocity.introspection.AnnotationBoxingUberspect] lookupMethod Velocity template accessing deprecated method com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultDraftManager#getMergedContent - /users/viewmydrafts.vm[line 70, column 68]
 -- url: /users/viewmydrafts.action | userName: admin | referer: https://localhost:8090/users/viewuserprofile.action | action: viewmydrafts{code}

h2. How to Replicate The Issue

# Add a new page and save it as user A
# Edit the page as user A, wait until a draft was saved, then cancel editing
# The draft version of the page is listed in username A > drafts ({{viewmydrafts.action}})
# Edit the page and save it *as user B*
# Reload {{viewmydrafts.action}} as user A, a draft version of the page is still listed
# Logs will write the deprecation warning

h2. Workaround

Suppress the noise {{WARN}} message from Confluence logs using the following steps
h3. Temporary
(i) Note the following change will get reset upon Confluence restart
# Access Confluence [Logging & Profiling|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Logging] page
# Add a new entry into the package field
#* {{com.atlassian.confluence.velocity.introspection.AnnotationBoxingUberspect}}
#* Set the level to {{ERROR}}
# Save

h3. Permanent
Edit your log4j.properties file as [instructed here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Logging#ConfiguringLogging-properties] and add this line:
{code}
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.confluence.velocity.introspection.AnnotationBoxingUberspect=ERROR
{code} 
Then restart Confluence.

h2. Notes

Please note that the stack trace is a {{WARN}} message that does not affect Confluence usage as the draft of the new page is still saved
fields.summary: WARN noise stack trace due to Confluence still uses deprecated method com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultDraftManager#getMergedContent in viewmydrafts.action

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27628].
  {panel}

We are investigating the newest Confluence.

After downloading JIRA evaluation version and installing to the Japanese OS, JIRA is shown in Japanese.
However, as the result of installing Confluence evaluation version to the same OS, Confluence is shown in English.

Could you confirm the installer of Confluence evaluation version ?
fields.summary: Confluence is shown in English on the Japanese OS.
Logging in as a User on a Browser Should Expire All Existing Sessions For That User
